description: recto: partially reclining body with long hair, leaning on his PL elbow, PR knee raised, looking up; boy wears jacket and knickers; verso: young man wearing long vest and knickers, with bare lower legs and feet, bending over to grasp a small barrel-like object; received framed with both sides of drawing visible
inscription:
Inscription

recto, at right edge, in pencil: [No 136]
provenance: Smet Collection. [Herbert Feist, New York, until 1973; sold, December 5, for $400, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1973-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Study of a Seated Boy (recto); Study of a Youth Standing (verso)
